story:
Once upon a time, in the mystical land of India, there lived a young prince named Arjun and his beloved mother, Queen Meera. Queen Meera was known far and wide for her wisdom and kindness, and she loved to tell stories to her son every night before he went to bed.

One night, as the moon shone brightly in the sky, Queen Meera began to tell a special story to Prince Arjun. It was a tale of the mighty elephant god, Ganesh. She told him how Ganesh was the remover of obstacles and the god of wisdom and knowledge.

Queen Meera told Prince Arjun that just like Ganesh, he too had the strength to overcome any obstacle that came his way. She reminded him to always be kind, compassionate, and brave, just like the great gods of their land.

As the story came to an end, Queen Meera tucked Prince Arjun into bed and kissed him gently on the forehead. She whispered a prayer for his safety and happiness, knowing that the gods were watching over him.

And so, with dreams of elephants and gods in his mind, Prince Arjun drifted off to sleep, feeling safe and loved in his mother's presence.

As the night passed, the stars twinkled above, casting their magical light upon the mother and son, filling their dreams with blessings and peace.

And in that moment, all was well in the kingdom of Prince Arjun and Queen Meera.

The end. Goodnight, my dear child. May your dreams be filled with magic and wonder.
